text: Comfortable restaurnt and food is delicious . Specially recommend bun bo hue

Ça faisait longtemps que je passais devant et y voyant bcp d asiatiques y manger je savais bien que je ne serais pas déçue ... C fait !!! Très bon restaurant les soupes ne sont vraiment pas cher et copieuse vraiment délicieuse j ai juste pris la soupe au buf saignant pour les reste je ne sais pas ... Le service était ok restaurant propre j étais déçus qu'il n'y est pas de musique viet pour accompagner mon lunch surtout qu'à 15h pas plus que 6 clients c était calme lol

A yummy vietnamese option in the Parc-Ex area!  The pho is great, especially beef broth.  The vegetarian broth lacked a punch, but it could also have been that we went early in the day.  The staff is young, and works hard considering how busy the restaurant gets at lunch and dinner times.  The food is fresh and very affordable.  They also have really great candies to take when you pay!!

Great affordable place and all the food is very fresh. I visit a lot as it is close to my house. Tried quite a few menu items but my favourites are the rare beef and brisket soup and their mixed dumplings and imperial rolls. Yum :)

One of many good vietnamese restaurants in town. The staff is young and dynamic and the ambiance is casual and friendly.

This place is near my school, and so my go-to meal is the bun bo hue (hue-style noodle soup), and it is in my opinion one of the best in town. There are also many other great dishes, such as com ba mao (rice with 2-way porc and a fried egg). Lyla also have many traditional vietnamese meals. One of my favorites is the bot chien (fried rice cakes with eggs served with soy sauce).

Overall, Lyla is a great place to discover vietnamese food without being too daring while respecting the classics.
Best Pho in MTL no doubt. The staff is very clever and friendly. They have an amazing Bun Bo hue, not too spicy. Finish it off with their che ba mau! 15% off for students, couldn't ask for more!

Delicious bùn! I tried out their no. 40 which was a lemongrass grilled chicken and definitely was fragrant! I'll have to admit though, I was hoping that they would have had just a grilled chicken offering. One of my friends had the Bún bò Hu which is a spicy lemongrass soup with a thicker noodle and beef! (The soup was oh so flavourful) The other friend had the Tai Pho, and again, the soup was clear and tasty! 

We also ordered a trio of appetizers: vegetarian Ch Giò, Gi Cun, and a dried beef and green papaya salad. Each of the sauces that came with these appetizers were remarkable!

Had the Pho (Number 20) and the beef was nice and tender but the broth was extremely salty.   

I had to add water to finish the soup.

If you are looking for Vietnamese in the Jean-Talon & Parc Ave. neighborhood this is a great spot. They have many delicious varieties of 'pho' on the menu as well as the 'bun' dishes (vermicelli noodles with salad and topping of your choice) and are all reasonably priced. I was initially off-put by the top-40 radio playing, but there were too many positive features to not make me a repeat customer - nice booths, friendly staff (family run!) and of course, fresh & delicious food. *Recommendations - Vegetarian pho and rice pancakes appetizer. BYOB.

Bon restaurant familial à 2 pas du Métro Parc. Bonne sélection. Le staff c'est la famille ou les amis de la famille, très sympathique et agréable. Ils sont habitué à dealer avec les rush des bureaux et business avoisinante et c'est en très grande partie leurs clientèle. Dans les restaurants Vietnamiens de Montréal, ils ne sont pas dans les meilleurs mais vont clairement mentions honorable! 

J'ai pas mal tous goûté sur le menu, leurs Phô sont définitivement bonne et sont à mon avis le meilleur rapport qualité prix. Si vers midi vous sortez au métro Parc et que ça sent vraiment bon dans l'air, C'est eux, y font leur bouillon pour leur soupe! haha!

Ils offrent livraison, take out et manger sur place. Les prix sont vraiment bon; Ils survivent à côté d'un Tim Hortons, McDonald's et Subway!

Refuser un chien guide qui accompagne une personne aveugle? Vraiment? 

Je retournerais jamais chez vous! 

Refusing a guide dog for a blind person? Really? 

I will never be your client again!
